<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARGOSY GAMING
COMPANY<br>
CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF <a name="cashflows">CASH FLOWS</a><br>
(In thousands, except share and per share data)</font></b></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="381" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:285.75pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="203" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:152.55pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minority interests</font></p>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="381" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:285.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash
  flows from investing activities:</font></b></p>
  </td>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\jms\chanson\04-3151-1\task87083\3151-1-do.htm',USER='chanson',CD='Mar  7 17:01 2004' -->



<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARGOSY GAMING
COMPANY<br>
<a name="equity">CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF STOCKHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY</a><br>
(In thousands, except share and per share data)</font></b></p>

  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.2pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#151;</font></p>

  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.6pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See accompanying notes to consolidated financial statements.</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">31</p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\jms\kdefran\04-3151-1\task90141\3151-1-dq.htm',USER='kdefran',CD='Mar 10 23:58 2004' -->



<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARGOSY GAMING
COMPANY<br>
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<br>
(In thousands, except share and per share data)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Summary of Significant Accounting
Policies</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basis
of Presentation&#151;</font></i></font>Argosy
Gaming Company provides casino-style gaming and related entertainment to the
public and, through our subsidiaries, operates riverboat casinos in Alton and
Joliet, Illinois; Lawrenceburg, Indiana; Riverside, Missouri; Baton Rouge,
Louisiana; and Sioux City, Iowa. Except where otherwise noted, the words &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us,&#148;
&#147;our&#148; and similar terms, as well as &#147;Argosy&#148; or the &#147;Company,&#148; refer to Argosy
Gaming Company and all of its subsidiaries.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation of financial statements in conformity
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States requires
management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported
in the financial statements and accompanying notes. Actual results could differ
from those estimates. The consolidated financial statements include our accounts
and those of our controlled subsidiaries and partnerships. We have eliminated
all significant intercompany transactions. Under certain conditions, our
subsidiaries are required to obtain approval from state gaming authorities
before making distributions to Argosy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain 2002 and 2001 amounts have been reclassified
to conform to the 2003 presentation.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
and Cash Equivalents&#151;</font></i></font>We
consider cash and all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of
three months or less to be cash equivalents.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and Equipment&#151;</font></i></font>We
record property and equipment at cost. We amortize leasehold improvements over
the life of the respective lease. Depreciation is computed on the straight-line
method over the following estimated useful lives:</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:40.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="406" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:304.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Buildings and
  shore improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:59.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5 to 33 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="406" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:304.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Riverboats,
  barges, docks and improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:59.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5 to 20 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="406" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:304.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Furniture,
  fixtures and equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:59.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 10 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment
of Long-Lived Assets&#151;</font></i></font>When
events or circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of long-lived assets
to be held and used might not be recoverable, the expected future undiscounted
cash flows from the assets is estimated and compared with the carrying amount
of the assets. If the sum of the estimated undiscounted cash flows were less
than the carrying amount of the assets, an impairment loss would be recorded. The
impairment loss would be measured on a location-by-location basis by comparing
the fair value of the assets with their carrying amount. Long-lived assets that
are held for disposal are reported at the lower of the assets&#146; carrying amount
or fair value less costs related to the assets&#146; disposition.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred Finance Costs&#151;</font></i></font>We
amortize deferred finance costs over the lives of the respective loans using
the effective interest method.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Goodwill&#151;</font></i></font>Goodwill
represents the cost of net assets acquired in excess of their fair value. In
accordance with SFAS 142 &#147;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets,&#148; effective January&nbsp;1,
2002, all goodwill is no longer regularly amortized, but is subject to
impairment testing at least annually. For all goodwill and intangible assets
acquired before June&nbsp;30, 2001, SFAS No.&nbsp;142 was implemented on January&nbsp;1,
2002. Refer to Note 8 for the impact of non-amortization of goodwill. We test
goodwill for impairment using the two-step process prescribed in SFAS No.&nbsp;142.
The first test is a screen for potential impairment, while the second step
measures the amount of the impairment, if any.</p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">32</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\jms\kdefran\04-3151-1\task89886\3151-1-ds.htm',USER='kdefran',CD='Mar 10 19:26 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other Intangible Assets&#151;</font></i></font>We
amortize other intangible assets over their estimated useful lives or the lives
of the respective leases or development agreements including extensions.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenues and Promotional Allowances&#151;</font></i></font>We
recognize as casino revenues the net win from gaming activities, which is the
difference between gaming wins and losses. &#160;We recognize admissions, hotel and other
revenue at the time the related service is performed.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
retail value of admissions, hotel rooms, food, beverage and other items, which
were provided to customers without charge, has been included in revenues, and a
corresponding amount has been deducted as promotional allowances. The estimated
direct cost of providing promotional allowances has been included in costs and
expenses as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:40.0pt;">

  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising Costs&#151;</font></i></font>We
expense advertising costs as incurred. Advertising expense was $15,122, $13,316
and $13,329 in 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">New Accounting Standards&#151;</font></i></font>In November&nbsp;2002,
the FASB issued FASI No.&nbsp;45, &#147;Guarantor&#146;s Accounting and Disclosure
Requirements for Guarantees, Including Indirect Guarantees of Indebtedness of
Others.&#148; &#160;This interpretation requires
certain guarantees to be initially recognized and recorded at fair value and
also increases disclosure requirements related to guarantees. The initial
recognition provisions are applicable to guarantees issued or modified after December&nbsp;31,
2002. We have adopted the disclosure requirements of FASI No.&nbsp;45 as of December&nbsp;31,
2002, and adopted the recognition requirements effective January&nbsp;1, 2003.
Such adoption did not have an impact on our consolidated balance sheets,
statements of income or statements of cash flows.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2002, the FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;148,
&#147;Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation&#151;Transition and Disclosure.&#148; &nbsp;SFAS
No.&nbsp;148 provides alternative methods of transition to SFAS No.&nbsp;123&#146;s
fair value method of accounting for stock-based employee compensation, but does
not require companies to use the fair value method. It also amends the
disclosure provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;123 and APB Opinion No.&nbsp;28 to
require disclosures in the summary of significant accounting policies of the
effects of an entity&#146;s accounting policy with respect to stock-based employee
compensation on reported net income and earnings per share in annual and
interim financial statements. The provisions of this statement are effective
for fiscal years ending after December&nbsp;15, 2002, and for interim reporting
periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2002. We adopted the disclosure
provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;148 in the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2002,
and such adoption did not have a material effect on our consolidated balance
sheets, statements of income or statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a stock-based
employee compensation plan and a stock-based director compensation plan, which
are described more fully in Note 11. We account for those plans under the
recognition and measurement principles of APB Opinion No.&nbsp;25, &#147;Accounting
for Stock Issued to Employees,&#148; and related Interpretations. No stock-based
employee compensation cost is reflected in net income, as all options granted
under those plans had an exercise price equal to the market value of the
underlying common stock on the date of grant. The effect on net income and
earnings per share if we had applied the fair value recognition provisions of
FASB No.&nbsp;123, &#147;Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation,&#148; to stock-based
employee compensation is a decrease in net income of $1,063, $557 and $389 and
a decrease in basic earnings per share of $.04, $.02 and $.02 and a decrease in
diluted earnings per share of $.04, $.01 and $.01 for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">33</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\jms\kdefran\04-3151-1\task89886\3151-1-ds.htm',USER='kdefran',CD='Mar 10 19:26 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Property and Equipment</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:40.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="348" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:261.1pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="130" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:97.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="348" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:261.1pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2003, we
recorded a $6,500 pretax charge to write-down assets originally planned for
expansion at our Joliet facility. Joliet&#146;s riverboats (replaced with a
barge-based two-level facility in May&nbsp;2003) with a net book value of $846
are held for sale at December&nbsp;31, 2003, and are included in other current
assets.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Intangible Assets</p>

  </td>
  <td width="53" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.4pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Weighted-<br>
  average<br>

expense of $2,359, $2,348 and $1,853 for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively. Future amortization expense of our existing
intangible assets for the years ended December&nbsp;31 is as follows:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">890,784</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="471" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:353.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Less: current maturities</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,648</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,469</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="471" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:353.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term debt,
  less current maturities</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">865,510</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">886,315</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have borrowings outstanding under two separate
Subordinated Notes issues totaling $556,623 (&#147;Subordinated Notes&#148;). Additionally,
we have entered into an amended and restated Senior Secured Line of Credit of
$400,000 and a Term Loan of $275,000 (together our &#147;Credit Facility&#148;). During
2003, we entered into the first and second amendments to our second amended and
restated credit agreement dated July&nbsp;31, 2001. These amendments modified
certain capital expenditure limitations and financial ratios while maintaining
our available line of credit and our Term Loan. The Credit Facility is secured
by liens on substantially all of our assets and our subsidiaries are
co-borrowers. Our wholly owned operating subsidiaries fully and unconditionally
guarantee the Subordinated Notes on a joint and several basis. The Subordinated
Notes rank junior to all of our senior indebtedness, including borrowings under
the Credit Facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Subordinated Notes and the Credit Facility contain
certain restrictions on the payment of dividends on our common stock and the
incurrence of additional indebtedness, as well as other customary debt
covenants. In addition, the Credit Facility requires us to maintain certain
financial ratios as follows:&#160; (1)&nbsp;Total
Funded Debt to EBITDA Ratio of a maximum of 4.25 to 1.0; (2)&nbsp;Senior
Leverage Ratio of a maximum of 2.50 to 1.0; and (3)&nbsp;Fixed Charge Ratio of
a minimum of 1.25 to 1.0. As of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003,
we were in compliance with these ratios. The Credit Facility is subject to
scheduled reductions of 2.5% to 5.0% of the total original borrowing
availability per quarter, beginning June&nbsp;30, 2003. We have $8,816 and
$7,536 in letters of credit outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002,
respectively. We have no off balance sheet debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2003, 2002 and 2001, was $75,752 (net of $3,214 capitalized), $81,305 (net of
$1,065 capitalized) and $67,569 (net of $291 capitalized), respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">35</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

debt matures as follows:</font></p>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">870,158</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;12, 2004,
we refinanced a portion of our existing indebtedness. We issued an aggregate of
$350,000 principal amount of new subordinated indebtedness due January&nbsp;15,
2014, with interest payable semi-annually at 7.0%. The net proceeds of this
issuance, together with funds from our Credit Facility, were used to repurchase
$329,317 of our 10</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">3</font><font face="Symbol">&#164;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;">4</font>%
Senior Subordinated Notes due 2009 and to pay a premium of $26,849.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Derivative Financial Instruments</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS 133, &#147;Accounting for Derivative Instruments and
Hedging Activities&#148; (adopted in 2001), requires all derivative financial
instruments, such as interest rate swaps, to be recognized as either assets or
liabilities in the balance sheet and measured at fair value. As we had no
outstanding derivative financial instruments at January&nbsp;1, 2001, adoption
of SFAS 133 had no impact on our financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We use interest rate swap agreements from separate
financial institutions to manage our interest rate risk associated with our
Term Loan as required under the Credit Facility. We have entered into three
interest rate swaps that have fixed the interest rate as of October&nbsp;31,
2001, for a combined original notional amount of $200,000 of our variable rate
Term Loan under our Credit Facility. The three separate swap agreements carry
original notional amounts of $100,000, $50,000 and $50,000. For each swap
agreement, we agree to receive a floating rate of interest on the notional amount
based upon a three month LIBOR rate (plus a 2.75% spread) in exchange for fixed
rates ranging from 6.19% to 6.27%. All three swap agreements mature on September&nbsp;30,
2004. Two of the three swap agreements have reductions in the notional amounts
proportionally with the quarterly payments on the Term Loan beginning December&nbsp;31,
2001. The total notional amounts are $197,750 at December&nbsp;31, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our present interest rate
swap agreements are cash flow hedges as we agree to pay fixed rates of
interest, which are hedging against changes in the amount of future cash flows
associated with variable interest obligations. Accordingly, the fair value of
our swap agreements is reported on the balance sheet in other current
liabilities ($3,236 pretax at December&nbsp;31, 2003) and the related change in
fair value of these agreements is included in stockholders&#146; equity as a
component of accumulated other comprehensive income ($1,942, net of taxes of
$1,294 at December&nbsp;31, 2003). These deferred amounts are then recognized
as an adjustment to interest expense over the same period in which the related
interest payments being hedged are recorded in income. If any of these
agreements are determined to have hedge ineffectiveness, the gains or losses
associated with the ineffective portion of these agreements are immediately
recognized in income. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, the
gains (losses) on the ineffective portion of our swap agreements were not
material to the consolidated financial statements.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">36</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\jms\kdefran\04-3151-1\task89886\3151-1-ds.htm',USER='kdefran',CD='Mar 10 19:26 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income Taxes</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income
tax (expense) for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001,
consists of the following:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  expense</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

tax effects of significant temporary differences representing deferred tax
assets and (liabilities) at December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 are as follows:</font></p>

 <tr>
  <td width="361" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:270.8pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="361" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:270.8pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="44" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(79,824</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="44" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(47,749</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have received proposed assessments from the Indiana
Department of Revenue (&#147;IDR&#148;) in connection with the examination of our Indiana
income tax returns for the years 1997 through 2001. Those assessments are based
on the IDR&#146;s position that state gaming taxes which are based on gaming
revenues are not deductible for Indiana income tax purposes. We have filed a
formal protest of the proposed assessment with the IDR. At December&nbsp;31,
2003, we have accrued other state taxes of $15,642, net of federal tax benefit,
for the proposed IDR assessments including amounts for additional pending
assessments for the years 2002 through 2003.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">37</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\jms\kdefran\04-3151-1\task89886\3151-1-ds.htm',USER='kdefran',CD='Mar 10 19:26 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The valuation allowance
relates to state deferred tax assets established under SFAS 109 for Louisiana
net operating loss carryforwards of approximately $10,064 and $16,300 at December&nbsp;31,
2003 and 2002, respectively. These loss carryforwards, which will expire from
2012 through 2019, will be carried forward to future years for possible
utilization.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Earnings Per Share</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted earnings per
share:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  <td width="351" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.1pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2003, employee stock options to
purchase 63,844 shares of common stock priced at a range of $21.75 to $35.18
per share and director stock options to purchase 20,500 shares of common stock
priced at a range of $22.30 to $39.99 per share, were not included in the
computation of diluted earnings per share because the options exercise price
was greater than the average market price of the common shares and, therefore,
the effect would be anti-dilutive. The remaining outstanding warrants were
converted into shares of common stock during the second quarter 2003. At December&nbsp;31,
2002, employee stock options to purchase 65,655 shares of common stock priced
at $35.18 per share and director stock options to purchase 3,000 shares of
common stock priced at $39.99 per share, were not included in the computation
of diluted earnings per share because the options exercise price was greater
than the average market price of the common shares and, therefore, the effect
would be anti-dilutive.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">38</p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The effect of
non-amortization of goodwill had SFAS 142 been effective at the beginning of
each year is as follows:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.43</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
paid $74,050, $79,741 and $54,477 for interest, and $5,342, $27,500 and $34,583
for income taxes in 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively. In 2003, we purchased
$149,831 in property and equipment, including $16,134 of purchases accrued at December&nbsp;31,
2003. This $16,134 has been netted against our purchases of property and
equipment and accounts payable in our statement of cash flows for 2003. In
2002, we purchased $59,646 in property and equipment, including $2,896 of purchases
accrued at December&nbsp;31, 2002. This $2,896 has been netted against our
purchases of property and equipment and accounts payable in our statement of
cash flows for 2002. We issued 368,313, 116,749 and 435,057 shares of
additional common stock resulting from the exercise of stock options and the
conversion of warrants during 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively. During 2003
and 2002, we recorded a tax benefit of $1,711 and $1,055, respectively, from
the exercise of common stock options.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Leases</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future
minimum lease payments for operating leases with initial terms in excess of one
year as of December&nbsp;31, 2003, are as follows:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18,704</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent expense for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, was $10,491, $11,891 and $10,014,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Stock Option Plans</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We adopted the Argosy Gaming Company Stock Option
Plan, as amended, (&#147;Stock Option Plan&#148;), which provides for the grant of
non-qualified stock options for up to 3,500,000 shares of common stock to our
key employees. These options expire 10 years after their respective grant dates
and become exercisable </font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">39</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\jms\jfernan\04-3151-1\task91269\3151-1-du.htm',USER='jfernan',CD='Mar 11 16:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">over specified vesting
periods. The weighted-average fair value of options granted was $8.38, $12.27
and $11.61 during 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also have adopted the Argosy Gaming Company 1993
Directors Stock Option Plan (&#147;Directors Option Plan&#148;), which provides for a
total of 100,000 shares of common stock to be authorized and reserved for
issuance. The Directors Option Plan provides for the grant of non-qualified
stock options at fair market value to our non-employee directors. These options
expire five years after their respective grant dates and become exercisable
over a specified vesting period. The weighted-average contractual life of
outstanding options at December&nbsp;31, 2003, is approximately 2.79 years and
the weighted-average exercise price of options outstanding is $30.54. The weighted-average
fair value of options granted during 2002 was $16.68.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of Stock Option activity is as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:40.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="208" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:156.3pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We follow Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.&nbsp;25,
&#147;Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees&#148; (&#147;APB 25&#148;), and related
interpretations in accounting for employee stock options. Under APB 25, we do
not recognize compensation expense when the exercise price of employee stock
options equals or exceeds the market price of the underlying stock on the date
of grant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have adopted the disclosure only provisions of SFAS 123 &#147;Accounting for Stock
Based Compensation.&#148;&#160; Accordingly, no
compensation expense has been recognized for either stock plan. The following
table discloses our pro forma net income and diluted net income per share had
the valuation methods under SFAS 123 been used for our stock option grants. The
table also discloses the weighted-</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">40</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\jms\jfernan\04-3151-1\task91269\3151-1-du.htm',USER='jfernan',CD='Mar 11 16:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">average assumptions used in estimating the fair value
of each option grant on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option
pricing model.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="19" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="296" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:222.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pro forma</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.05pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="72" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.72</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These pro forma amounts to
reflect SFAS 123 option expense may not be representative of future disclosures
because the estimated fair value of the options is amortized to expense over
the vesting period and additional options may be granted in the future.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Employee Benefit Plan</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We established a 401(k)
defined-contribution plan, which covers substantially all of our full-time
employees. Participants can contribute a portion of their eligible salaries (as
defined) subject to maximum limits, as determined by provisions of the Internal
Revenue Code. We match a portion of participants&#146; contributions in an amount
determined annually by us. Expense recognized under the plan was approximately
$2,366, $2,477 and $1,935 in 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Acquisitions</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our 2003 and 2002 financial statements fully
consolidate acquisitions completed in 2001. In the first quarter 2001, we
purchased the 42.5% limited partnership interests in the Argosy Casino and
Hotel in Lawrenceburg, Indiana (the &#147;Lawrenceburg Casino&#148;) for an aggregate
price of $365,000 including all preferred equity interests and outstanding
partner loans. As a result of these acquisitions, we own 100% of the
Lawrenceburg Casino.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The purchase prices for the minority interests were
determined based upon estimates of future cash flows and evaluations of the net
worth of the assets acquired. The purchases were accounted for under the
purchase method. Our purchase price allocation resulted in approximately
$298,000 in goodwill, which was being amortized over a 40-year life. In
accordance with SFAS 142, amortization of the remaining book value of goodwill
ceased as of January&nbsp;1, 2002, and is tested for impairment at least
annually. The purchases were funded with approximately $155,000 of net proceeds
from the issuance of Subordinated Notes and borrowings of approximately
$210,000 under our Credit Facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;31, 2001, we
diversified our operations and cash flows by completing the acquisition of 100%
of the Empress Casino Joliet Corporation (with casino operations located in
Joliet, Illinois) for </font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">41</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\jms\jfernan\04-3151-1\task91269\3151-1-du.htm',USER='jfernan',CD='Mar 11 16:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">approximately
$463,764. The purchase price was determined based upon estimates of future cash
flows and the net worth of the assets acquired. We funded this acquisition
through the issuance of Subordinated Notes and borrowings under the Credit
Facility. The results of operations for the Empress Casino Joliet for the five
months ended December&nbsp;31, 2001, since the acquisition, are included in our
consolidated statements of income.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Fair Value of Financial Instruments</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
estimated fair values of our financial instruments at December&nbsp;31, 2003,
are as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">376,688</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="332" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:248.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other long-term debt</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,210</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="332" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="45" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of the
Subordinated Notes and Term Loan is based on quoted market prices. We estimate
the fair value of the remainder of our long-term debt approximates carrying
value.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Quarterly Financial Information
(unaudited)</p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;">

</font></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;">(1)<font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>During the second
quarter 2002, Illinois and Indiana enacted state legislation increasing gaming
and admission tax rates. During the second quarter 2003, Illinois enacted
additional legislation increasing gaming and admission tax rates.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We
recorded a $6,500 million write down of assets at our Joliet facility related
to assets previously held for future development. Additionally, we recorded a
$5,900 million charge at our Indiana facility due to legislation enacted
regarding the calculation of the 2002 Indiana gaming tax rate increase.</p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">42</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\jms\jfernan\04-3151-1\task91269\3151-1-du.htm',USER='jfernan',CD='Mar 11 16:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Commitments and Contingent Liabilities</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are subject, from time to time, to various legal
and regulatory proceedings in the ordinary course of business. We believe
current proceedings will not have a material effect on our financial condition
or the results of our operations.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">43</p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\jms\jfernan\04-3151-1\task91269\3151-1-du.htm',USER='jfernan',CD='Mar 11 16:12 2004' -->



<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="reportofindependentauditors"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">REPORT OF
INDEPENDENT AUDITORS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors<br>
Argosy Gaming Company</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance
sheets of Argosy Gaming Company as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 and the
related consolidated statements of income, stockholders&#146; equity and cash flows
for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. Our
audits also included the financial statement schedule listed in the Index at
Item 15(a)2. These financial statements and schedule are the responsibility of
the Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these
financial statements and schedule based on our audits.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We conducted our audits in accordance with auditing
standards generally accepted in the United States. Those standards require that
we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes
examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting
principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as
evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our
audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, the financial statements referred to
above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial
position of Argosy Gaming Company at December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 and the
consolidated results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three
years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 in conformity with accounting
principles generally accepted in the United States. Also, in our opinion, the
related financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic
financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly in all material respects
the information set forth therein.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 1 to the Notes to Consolidated
Financial Statements, in 2002 the Company changed its method of accounting for
goodwill to conform with Financial Accounting Standards Board Statement No.&nbsp;142.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="322" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:241.8pt;">
  <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="286" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:214.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ERNST&nbsp;&amp; YOUNG
  LLP</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="608" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:455.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Chicago, Illinois</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="608" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:455.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">January&nbsp;30, 2004, except for Note 5 as to which
  the date is February&nbsp;12, 2004.</font></p>
  </td>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">44</p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\jms\jfernan\04-3151-1\task91269\3151-1-dw.htm',USER='jfernan',CD='Mar 11 16:13 2004' -->



<div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.4pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.4pt;"><a name="item9"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM 9.&nbsp;&nbsp; CHANGES IN
AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item9a"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM
9A.&nbsp;&nbsp; CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</font></b></a></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Evaluation
of disclosure controls and procedures:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We maintain disclosure controls and procedures that
are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed in our
Exchange Act reports is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the
time periods specified in the Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and forms, and that such
information is accumulated and communicated to our management including our
President and Chief Executive Officer and Senior Vice President and Chief
Financial Officer, as appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required
disclosure.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of the end of
the period covered by this Report, December&nbsp;31, 2003, (the &#147;Evaluation
Date&#148;), we carried out an evaluation, under the supervision and with the
participation of the Company&#146;s management, including Richard J. Glasier, our
President and Chief Executive Officer and Dale R. Black, our Senior Vice
President and Chief Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of the design and
operation of our disclosure controls and procedures. Based upon that
evaluation, the President and Chief Executive Officer and the Senior Vice
President and Chief Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls
and procedures were effective as of the Evaluation Date.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Changes in
internal controls:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There was no change in the
Company&#146;s internal controls during the period covered by this Report that could
materially affect, or could reasonably be expected to materially affect, the
Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">45</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;page-break-before:always;text-align:center;"><a name="partiii"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;III</font></b></a></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item10"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM
10.&nbsp;&nbsp; DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE REGISTRANT</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information regarding
directors is incorporated herein by reference from the Company&#146;s definitive
proxy statement filed March&nbsp;11, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item11"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM

reference from the Company&#146;s definitive proxy statement filed March&nbsp;11,
2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item12"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Incorporated herein by
reference from the Company&#146;s definitive proxy statement filed March&nbsp;11,
2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item13"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM
13.&nbsp;&nbsp; CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item14"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="partiv"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;IV</font></b></a></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="item15"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM </font></b></a><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;</font>15.&nbsp;&nbsp; EXHIBITS, FINANCIAL
STATEMENT SCHEDULES, AND REPORTS ON FORM&nbsp;8-K</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The following documents
are filed as part of this Form&nbsp;10-K.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Consolidated
financial statements filed as part of this report are listed under Part&nbsp;II,
Item 8, pages 27 through 44 of this Form&nbsp;10-K.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The following
consolidated financial schedules of Argosy Gaming Company are included in
response to Item 15 (a):</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Condensed
Financial Information for Parent Company Only Schedule I.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All other schedules
specified under Regulation S-X for Argosy Gaming Company have been omitted
because they are either non-applicable, not required or because the information
required is included in the financial statements or notes thereto.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
exhibits listed on the &#147;Index to Exhibits&#148; on pages 47 through 51 are filed
with this Form&nbsp;10-K or incorporated by reference as set forth below.</p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="42" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:31.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.13</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="551" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:413.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By-laws of Jazz Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc. (previously

  Agreement (previously filed with the SEC as an Exhibit&nbsp;to the Company&#146;s
  Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-1 filed with the SEC on

  </td>
 </tr>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The following Reports on
Form&nbsp;8-K were filed by the Registrant with the Securities and
Exchange Commission during the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Report on Form&nbsp;8-K dated October&nbsp;28,
2003, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, furnishing the press
release dated October&nbsp;28, 2003, announcing the Company&#146;s third quarter
operating results for the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Exhibits filed
herewith, if any, are identified on the Exhibit&nbsp;index.</p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;">51</p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="signatures"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SIGNATURES</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this Report to be signed
on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized on the &nbsp;11th
day of March 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 9.0pt;text-indent:-9.0pt;">* Dale R. Black, by signing
his name hereto, does sign this document on behalf of the above-named individuals,
pursuant to the powers of attorney duly executed by such individuals, which
have been filed as an exhibit to this Registration Statement.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARGOSY GAMING
COMPANY<br>
SCHEDULE I&#151;CONDENSED
FINANCIAL INFORMATION OF REGISTRANT (Continued)<br>
<a name="scheduleinotes">NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </a>(Parent Company only)<br>
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basis of
presentation</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying condensed financial information of
Argosy Gaming Company (&#147;Argosy&#148;) includes the accounts of Argosy, and on an
equity basis, the subsidiaries that it controls. The accompanying condensed
financial information should be read in conjunction with the consolidated
financial statements of Argosy. Certain prior year financial information has
been reclassified to conform to 2003 presentation.</font></p>
